intro: Manihot sellowiana, commonly known as the arrowleaf balsam, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Manihot sellowiana is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
